Class MemoList<T>

java.lang.Object
MemoList<T>
class MemoList<T> extends Object
A wrapper around a lazily evaluated and memoized list that can be generated with a lambda expression.

  • Field Summary

  • Method Details

    • generate

      public static <T> MemoList<T> generate(int n, T seed, cs2030s.fp.Immutator<? extends T,? super T> f)
      Generate the content of the list. Given x and a lambda f, generate the list of n elements as [x, f(x), f(f(x)), f(f(f(x))), ... ]
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the list.
      Parameters:
      n - The number of elements.
      seed - The first element.
      f - The immutator function on the elements.
      Returns:
      The created list.

    • generate

      public static <T> MemoList<T> generate(int n, T first, T snd, cs2030s.fp.Combiner<? extends T,? super T,? super T> f)
      Generates a list based on the combination of its components.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The datatype of items in the list.
      Parameters:
      n - Number of elements in the list.
      first - First element in the list.
      snd - Second element in the list.
      f - Combiner used to combine two elements in the list.
      Returns:
      A new MemoList<T> with combiner applied to its elements in pairs.

    • map

      public <R> MemoList<R> map(cs2030s.fp.Immutator<? extends R,? super T> f)
      Transforms each item in the list using an immutator.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The datatype of items in the list.
      Parameters:
      f - The immutator used to transform items in the list.
      Returns:
      A new MemoList<R> with immutator applied onto its elements.

    • flatMap

      public <R> MemoList<R> flatMap(cs2030s.fp.Immutator<? extends MemoList<R>,? super T> f)
      Flattens nested list into a single dimension list.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The datatype of items in the list.
      Parameters:
      f - The immutator that is used to generate nested MemoList<R>.
      Returns:
      A flattened MemoList<R>.

      Return the element at index i of the list.
